alert.note: Alert for Hampden (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 10 at 10:07PM EDT until July 12 at 7:22PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Massachusetts...Connecticut... Connecticut River At Montague affecting Hampshire and Franklin Counties. Connecticut River Below Holyoke affecting Hampden County. Connecticut River At Northampton affecting Hampshire and Hampden Counties. Connecticut River ABOVE Holyoke Dam affecting Hampden County. Connecticut River At Thompsonville affecting Hampden and Hartford Counties. Connecticut River At Hartford affecting Middlesex and Hartford Counties. Farmington River At Simsbury affecting Hartford County. ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Massachusetts... Deerfield At Charlemont affecting Berkshire and Franklin Counties. West Deerfield River AT West Deerfield affecting Franklin County. For the Connecticut River...including Montague, Northampton, Holyoke Dam, Holyoke, Springfield, Thompsonville, Hartford, Middle Haddam... Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Farmington River...including Unionville, Simsbury, Tariffville...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Deerfield River...including Charlemont, West Deerfield... Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY MORNING TO WEDNESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Connecticut River below Holyoke. * WHEN...From Tuesday morning to Wednesday evening. * IMPACTS...At 29.0 feet, Flooding will continue to spead across low lying areas from Holyoke south through Agawam. Inundation of areas which are outside of local levee protection is likely. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:30 PM EDT Monday the stage was 17.4 feet. - Bankfull stage is 26.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tomorrow morning to a crest of 29.1 feet early Wednesday morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Wednesday afternoon. - Flood stage is 26.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 27.7 feet on 08/30/2011. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Tuesday morning at 1015 AM EDT.
